title: Milan1009
author: Milan1009
created_time: May 23, 2022, 05:36:57 AMLast edit: May 24, 2022, 07:11:09 PM by Milan1009
content: Have you considered the possibility to enter on this crypto branch?Projects like Dwellfi and Citadel have been positioning early as projects that will be part of the future of Real Estate and will be giving opportunities to people eager to participate on this niche, but, at the moment don't have the possibility on the traditional market.Share with me your ideas about these kind of projects.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Milan1009 on May 23, 2022, 05:36:57 AMHave you considered the possibility to enter on this crypto branch?Projects like Dwellfi and Citadel have been positioning early as projects that will be part of the future of Real State and will be giving opportunities to people eager to participate on this niche, but, at the moment don't have the possibility on the traditional market.Share with me your ideas about these kind of projects.Real state nft is something not yet weve seen if were gonna be succesful. But if you are into traditional business, wouls you choose a real real state property or a digital one? Its goes boils down to appetite cause this could be a risky thing too. Its only existing virtually and cant be convertrd into real one. Unless thats the concept of real state nft to buy out property and the nft signify ownership for that and easy buying and selling. Anyway I am watching too how this will play out.

comments.author: Razanm90
comments.body: Quote from: Milan1009 on May 23, 2022, 05:36:57 AMHave you considered the possibility to enter on this crypto branch?Projects like Dwellfi and Citadel have been positioning early as projects that will be part of the future of Real State and will be giving opportunities to people eager to participate on this niche, but, at the moment don't have the possibility on the traditional market.Share with me your ideas about these kind of projects.It is interesting and I agree with the opinions above. I am interested in some NFT projects, so I want to find a great p2e game, which will be fascinating and profitable. I have heard about one p2e game few days ago. They have such a good arts and stories, their community grows by the day. I think that this project will succeed. It is called Reptile Chronicles. Have you heard about that?

comments.author: mindrust
comments.body: I am not really supporting NFT's because I don't see any real world use for them. To me they are just speculative gambling devices. You can make money from them indeed but it is weird to compare NFT's with real life assets like apartments, farmland etc. I'd rather own farm lands like Bill Gates than having wurthless NFT's especially now is a good time when the food prices are soaring. Soon a slice of bread will cost a lot more than what it does now and your NFT's are not going to feed you. Investing in food makes more sense in this regard.

comments.author: BitcoinPanther
comments.body: I can't see any connection between real estate and NFT except the documentation.   Physical properties can't be put into NFT except the land titles.Quote from: AbuBhakar on May 23, 2022, 06:01:13 AMThe legal process of transfer to the owner is very complex I don't think it is that complex because transfer of title of documents will be the same except for the addition of the NFT copy.  It will be complicated if someone mixes a token into the process and if it does, it is surely a money grab project.

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: Something similar was said when there was a hype in the field of NFT, that NFT in the field of art will be a breakthrough and hurry to enter this industry, because the world has not seen anything like this. But in fact few people are interested in it from an artistic point of view, most people see it as a speculative component. In the same way Real State NFTs will be perceived. Just another type of NFT tokens, which can be speculated with and profit. There is no other use for these tokens yet, which is why most of them depreciate so quickly.

comments.author: jossiel
comments.body: I haven't played decentraland but I think this is also their concept.We shall see if NFTs are still going to be at the top of its chain for the next years. But definitely, those that are worth it shall stay and if there's still a value on it from its own community.Those rich folks that don't have anything to spend with would probably invest on this and actually, there are many of them. But for me, I'll go with the typical bitcoin portfolio and have a real estate where I can stay.

comments.author: MrDave
comments.body: i don't know that what we are going to have next

comments.body: LABS Group. Tokenized Real Estate, not virtual lands, real properties tokenized and fractionalized. They even have yield returns I think.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: Milan1009 on May 23, 2022, 05:36:57 AMHave you considered the possibility to enter on this crypto branch?Projects like Dwellfi and Citadel have been positioning early as projects that will be part of the future of Real Estate and will be giving opportunities to people eager to participate on this niche, but, at the moment don't have the possibility on the traditional market.Share with me your ideas about these kind of projects.We are talking about NFT that represent the owner ship of a real estate in the real world here right? If that is the case, then i don't really see the benefit of managing the ownership of real estates via NFT's instead of doing it via a notary. I don't even know if it is possible to do a real estate trade via an NFT. So far you always needed a notary that would confirm to you that you are now the owner of a real estate which also cost some money but it was needed in order to be the official owner. I don't think that it would be enough to just own the NFT of a real estate to be the official owner of a real estate in the view of he government an the authorities.Therefore i think that first legal issues need to be clarified.

comments.author: btc_angela
comments.body: Quote from: Milan1009 on May 23, 2022, 05:36:57 AMHave you considered the possibility to enter on this crypto branch?Projects like Dwellfi and Citadel have been positioning early as projects that will be part of the future of Real Estate and will be giving opportunities to people eager to participate on this niche, but, at the moment don't have the possibility on the traditional market.Share with me your ideas about these kind of projects.As others have said, this might be a complicated industries specially for NFTs. But as far as blockchain projects goes, yeah, they could benefit from the all those data being written in the blockchain database, so it's very safe and the transaction is going to be very fast as compare to the old and traditional way of buying real state projects. But now entering NFTs? there could be steps to ensure that there will be no scams running those NFTs on the first place. But anyhow, this could also be the start of something big so this could be the next trend but with a lot of challenges.
